agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Business & Industry TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Tuesday, April 9, 2019 PLACE: E2.016 CHAIR: Rep. Trey Martinez Fischer The committee will meet to hear invited testimony from a Texas business leader regarding the Texas business climate and industry trends. After that, the committee will hear public testimony on the following: HB 572 González, Mary Relating to eligibility for unemployment compensation for employees who leave the workplace due to sexual harassment. HB 750 Walle Relating to required provision of workers' compensation insurance coverage for employees of building and construction contractors and subcontractors. HB 970 Walle Relating to notice requirements for leased residential property, manufactured home lots, or commercial property located in a flood zone. HB 1396 Harless Relating to the eligibility of certain persons to serve on the board of a property owners' association. HB 1521 Burrows | et al. Relating to liability of certain political subdivisions in certain workers' compensation actions. HB 1575 Turner, Chris Relating to sexual harassment prevention training and information for employees. HB 1658 Bell, Cecil Relating to seller's disclosure of certain residential real property conditions and related property insurance issues. HB 1992 Leman | et al. Relating to prohibiting telemarketers from transmitting misleading caller identification information or otherwise misrepresenting the origin of a telemarketing call. HB 2143 Turner, John Relating to the eligibility of a first responder for workers' compensation benefits for post-traumatic stress disorder. HB 2501 Bowers Relating to the ability of a nonexempt employee to participate in certain academic, extracurricular, and developmental activities of the employee's child. HB 2503 Kacal Relating to workers' compensation death benefit eligibility for certain spouses of first responders killed in the line of duty. HB 2685 Bailes Relating to workers' compensation death benefit eligibility for certain spouses of first responders and certain other public servants killed in the line of duty. HB 3815 Morrison Relating to requiring notices of property located in floodplains, flood pools, or reservoirs to be provided by sellers of real property and on subdivision plats. HB 3996 Burrows Relating to liability of certain political subdivisions in certain workers' compensation actions. HB 4262 Darby Relating to aircraft liens NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
